title: 2 killed, 4 injured in Sunday night shootings in Stockton
content:
STOCKTON - Homicide detectives were busy processing two murder scenes early today after two people were killed and four others wounded in separate shootings late Sunday night in Stockton, authorities said.
STOCKTON - Homicide detectives were busy processing two murder scenes early today after two people were killed and four others wounded in separate shootings late Sunday night in Stockton, authorities said.
The first shooting occurred about 8 p.m. outside a home in the 1800 block of East Sonora Street near Stribley Park in central Stockton, police said. Five people were struck by bullets, including one who was pronounced dead a short time later, authorities said.
The second shooting was reported about 10:15 p.m., less than two miles away in the 700 block of East Clay Street in south Stockton, police said. One person was killed, said Office Joe Silva, a spokesman for the Stockton Police Department.
Silva said it was unknown whether the two shootings were related. Names of the victims were not released and police did not provide descriptions of the gunmen, but one person was detained in connection with the shooting on East Clay Street, Silva said.
The two people who were gunned down are Stockton's fourth and fifth homicide victims of 2013. Their deaths came days after the Police Department released figures showing a dramatic decrease in violent crime over the first two months of 2013 compared with the same period in 2012, when the city set a record with 71 homicides.
For more on this story, read Tuesday's Record.
